verses.text: 給撒狄教會的信「你要寫信給在撒狄教會的使者，說：『那有 神七靈和七星的這樣說：我知道你的行為，你有名聲，說你是活著的，其實你是死的。

words.note: Literally 'teaching assembly'.
Can refer to human messengers or angels.
Capitalized when referring to the Christian God.
Refers to the Holy Spirit or spirits.
Refers to one's conduct or behavior.

verses.text: 你要警醒，把那些剩下來將要死的堅強起來；因為我見你的行為在我 神面前是不完全的。

words.note: Often used in a spiritual sense of vigilance.
Indicates an upward movement or the start of an action.

verses.text: 所以，你應當回想你是怎樣領受、怎樣聽見的；應該遵守，也應該悔改。你若不警醒，我就要像賊來到一樣。我甚麼時候來到你那裡，你決不能知道。

words.note: Often used in the context of receiving spiritual gifts or teachings.
A core concept in Christian theology.

verses.text: 然而在撒狄你還有幾名是未曾玷污自己衣服的，他們要身穿白衣與我同行；因為他們是配得上的。

words.note: Can also mean 'name'.
Often used in a moral or spiritual sense.
Symbolic of purity or victory in the Bible.

verses.text: 得勝的，也必這樣身穿白衣，我決不從生命冊上塗抹他的名，我還要在我父和他的眾天使面前，承認他的名。

words.note: A key theme in Revelation, referring to spiritual triumph.
Stronger than 'will'; expresses certainty.
Often found in '生命冊' (Book of Life).
A biblical idiom for removing someone's name from a list or record.
Used as a title for God the Father.
Pluralizes the following noun.
Literally 'heavenly messenger'.

verses.text: 聖靈向眾教會所說的話，有耳的就應當聽。』

words.note: Lit. 'holy spirit'
Lit. 'teaching assembly'
Forms a noun phrase 'that which is spoken'.
Turns preceding phrase into a noun clause.
Forms a noun phrase 'one who has ears'.

verses.text: 給非拉鐵非教會的信「你要寫信給在非拉鐵非教會的使者，說：『那聖潔的、真實的，拿著大衛的鑰匙，開了就沒有人能關，關了就沒有人能開的，這樣說：

words.note: Lit. 'teaching assembly'
Verb-object compound
Lit. 'teaching assembly'
Lit. 'sent one'
Turns adjective into a noun phrase.
Turns adjective into a noun phrase.
Verb with aspect particle -zhe indicating continuous action.

words.definition: there is not, to not have
there is not, to not have
there is not, to not have

verses.text: 我知道你的行為，看哪！我已經在你面前給你一道開著的門，是沒有人能關的；因為你有一點點力量，也遵守我的道，沒有否認我的名。

words.note: Verb 'open' with aspect particle -zhe indicating state.

words.definition: there is not, to not have

words.note: Often refers to God's word or path.
Used to negate past actions.

verses.text: 看哪！從撒但的一黨，就是自稱是猶太人，其實不是猶太人，而是說謊的人中，我要使他們一些人來在你腳前下拜，並且知道我已經愛了你。

words.note: Verb-object compound
Forms a noun phrase 'lying people'.
Verb-object compound

verses.text: 你既然遵守了我忍耐的道，我也必定保守你脫離那試煉的時候；這就是那將要臨到普天下，來試煉住在地上的人的時候。

words.note: Often refers to God's word or path.

words.definition: to escape from, be free from

words.note: Refers to a period of testing or affliction.
Lit. 'all under heaven'.
Forms a noun phrase 'those who live on earth'.

verses.text: 我必快來！你要持守你所有的，不要讓人拿走你的冠冕。

words.note: Refers to a royal or honorary crown.

verses.text: 得勝的，我要叫他在我 神的聖所裡作柱子，他決不再出去，我也要把我 神的名，和我 神的城的名，就是那從天上、從我 神那裡降下來的新耶路撒冷，以及我的新名，都寫在他身上。

words.note: The space before 神 indicates reverence in some Bible translations.

verses.text: 聖靈向眾教會所說的話，有耳的就應當聽。』

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for 'all believers' or 'many'.

verses.text: 給老底嘉教會的信「你要寫信給在老底嘉教會的使者，說：『那位阿們的，忠信真實的見證人， 神創造萬有的根源，這樣說：

words.note: A transliteration of 'Amen', meaning 'so be it' or 'truly'.

verses.text: 我知道你的行為，你不冷也不熱；我巴不得你或冷或熱。

words.note: Common idiom with a significant spiritual meaning in this biblical context.
Literally 'wish not to obtain (anything else but)', meaning 'ardently wish'.

verses.text: 因為你好像溫水，不熱也不冷，所以我要把你從我口中吐出去。

words.note: Contextually referring to a spiritual state.
Directional particle indicating departure.

verses.text: 你說：我是富足的，已經發了財，毫無缺乏。卻不知你是困苦的、可憐的、貧窮的、瞎眼的、赤身的。

words.note: Refers to perceived spiritual wealth.
Often used in spiritual context of needing God.
Describes a dire spiritual condition.
Describes a dire spiritual condition.
Describes a dire spiritual condition.
Contextually refers to spiritual blindness.
Contextually refers to spiritual nakedness or shame.

verses.text: 我勸你向我買精煉的金子，使你富足；又買白衣穿上，使你赤身的羞恥不會顯露出來；也買眼藥膏抹你的眼睛，使你可以看見。

words.note: Refers to true spiritual wealth from Christ.
Symbolic of purity and righteousness in the Bible.
Directional complement indicating revelation or emergence.

verses.text: 凡是我所愛的，我就責備管教；所以你要熱心，也要悔改。

words.note: Indicates the following verb acts on a preceding object.
Forms a phrase 'those whom I love'.
Divine correction and warning.
Refers to divine discipline for spiritual growth.
Implies spiritual zeal and earnestness.
A core theological concept of turning from sin.

verses.text: 看哪！我站在門外敲門；如果有人聽見我的聲音就開門的，我要進到他那裡去，我要跟他在一起，他也要跟我在一起吃飯。

words.note: Often used in scripture to draw attention to a significant statement.
Forms a phrase 'the one who opens the door'.

verses.text: 得勝的，我必定賜他和我一同坐在我的寶座上，正像我得了勝和我父一同坐在他的寶座上一樣。

words.note: Lit. 'obtain victory'
Turns the preceding verb phrase into a noun phrase, meaning 'the one who...'
Often used in formal or religious contexts.
Used as a postposition indicating location.
Refers to God the Father in this context.
Used as a postposition indicating location.

verses.text: 聖靈向眾教會所說的話，有耳的就應當聽。』」

words.note: Often used in formal or literary contexts, or with groups.
A nominalized verb phrase, 'that which is spoken'.
Part of a common biblical idiom, 'he who has ears'.
Turns the preceding verb phrase into a noun phrase, meaning 'the one who...'
